start.title: How to Use the Application
start.description:
Welcome to the WiFi Heatmap application!

To get started, follow these simple steps:
  • Upload a floor plan: Add an image of your floor plan (PNG, JPG, JPEG, or PDF).
  • Scan: Perform a Wi-Fi scan by clicking on your current position on the map.
  • Visualize: View the results on a heatmap.
⚠️ Once a step is completed, you don't need to repeat it unless you want to start over.

plan.main_title: How to Interact with Floor Plans
plan.title_1: How to Upload a Floor Plan
plan.description_1:
You can upload a plan from two different pages: the Plans page and the Scans page.
On both, click the corresponding button.
⚠️ Only PNG, JPG, JPEG, and PDF formats are supported.
plan.title_2: How to Delete a Floor Plan
plan.description_2:
Floor plans can only be deleted from the Plans page.
Click the trash bin icon on the plan you want to delete.
This action will also delete all scan data associated with that plan.

scans.description_1:
The Scans page allows you to perform scans on the selected floor plan.
⚠️ Each new scan deletes the previous scan data.

You can save and load different scans to compare multiple analyses on the same plan.
The scan file name can be freely edited.
scans.description_2:
To start a scan:
  • Click your computer’s current position on the map.
  • Wait until the scan is complete (3 seconds on Linux, 15 seconds on Windows).
  • Do not move during the scan.
A loading bar will appear during the process and disappear once it’s done.

maps.description_1:
First, select the desired map.
Then, choose the Wi-Fi network you want to visualize.
By hovering over a circle, you can see the signal strength and the MAC address of the transmitting radio.
